Anne Marthe Sophie Ngo Bibinbe

PhD Student in Computer Vision, Laval University

Resume

About Me

I am a PhD student specializing in computer vision with a focus on animal behavior tracking. My research spans video understanding, vision-language models, and anomaly detection in time-series data. I am particularly interested in advancing long-term tracking and prompt-driven detection systems. Beyond academia, I aspire to apply my expertise in large vision models toward impactful innovations and entrepreneurial ventures.

Experience

PhD Student

Laval University, Québec — 2022–Present

Research on multi-object tracking and behavior analysis.
  • Developed PromptTrack , a PyPI library for prompt-based object tracking.
  • Proposed an HMM-based framework for merging identity and appearance cues for long-term MOT (Oral CVPR 2024 animal workshop).
  • Designed an unsupervised pipeline to detect pig aggression and locate entities using Conv3D autoencoder + tracking.
  • Benchmarked multi-object and multi-animal tracking methods on livestock context.

Visiting PhD Student

University of Central Florida (3 monthqs exchange) 2025

Working on zero-shot spatio-temporal action detection(STAD).
  • Fine-tuning InternVideo to build a prompt-based STAD model inspired by OWL-ViT.
  • Designing tubelet proposal strategy conditioned on input action prompts to tackle prompt-based STAD.

AI Consultant

Machinex, Québec — Winter 2024–Present

AI development for robotic material sorting in factories.
  • Developing models for factory sorting robots.
  • Built test-time adaptation modules to handle distribution shifts between factories.
  • Developed a model to estimate material weight from 2D images.

AI Researcher

CNRS/Pfeiffer-Vacuum, France — 2021–2022

Focus on streaming anomaly detection and explainable AI.
  • Proposed DragStream: explainable method for concept drift and anomaly detection in real-time streams (ICDM 2022).
  • Benchmark datastream anomaly detection approaches.
  • Developed a real-time analytics tool for monitoring air contamination data.

Junior Machine Learning Engineer

Omdena, California — Winter 2021

Collaboration on wellness and health optimization app.
  • Built a recommendation system to help users reduce their biological age through activity suggestions (This experience was a great Collaboration with a lot of persons from several places in the world)

MSc in Computer Science (Data Track)

Computer Engineering

Polytechnique Yaoundé, Cameroon — 2020

Publications

  • CV4Animals: CVPR 2024
    An HMM-based framework for identity-aware long-term MOT from sparse and uncertain identification: use case on long-term tracking in livestock.
    Anne Marthe Sophie Ngo Bibinbe, Patrick Gagnon, Jamie Ahloy-Dallaire, Eric R. Paquet
  • ICDMW 2022
    DragStream: An Anomaly and Concept Drift Detector in Univariate Data Streams.
    Sophie Ngo Bibinbe, Abdoul Mahamadou, Michael Mbouopda, Engelbert Mephu Nguifo
  • IJCNN IEEE 2022
    A Survey on Unsupervised Learning Algorithms for Detecting Abnormal Points in Streaming Data.
    Sophie Ngo Bibinbe, Michael Mbouopda, Raissa Mbiadeu Saleu, Engelbert Mephu
  • EGC 2022 (Short Article)
    Benchmarking Unsupervised Methods for Abnormal Point Detection in Data Stream.
    Sophie Ngo Bibinbe, Michael Mbouopda, Raissa Mbiadeu Saleu, Engelbert Mephu

Open Source

  • PromptTrack (PyPI)
    Development of the PromptTrack library for prompt-based object tracking: PromptTrack on PyPI
